description: Who You Are Versay Solutions is seeking a Conversational AI Specialist (NLU) to join our Conversational Design and Applied Linguistics Team to help deliver customer-facing voice and chat experiences. Your primary responsibility will be to build custom NLU models for our RASA platform to support customers. This role is team-oriented and customer-facing, as you will collaborate with the client and other technical staff to accomplish project deliverables. In addition, as we move forward to adapt our platforms and products to include generative AI, we will be looking for someone who is interested in technologies and techniques around designing and building chat and voice bots using RAG and other AI tools. The ideal candidate will have a strong linguistics and machine learning background. They will have knowledge of natural language processing and generation (NLP/NLG), script design processes, and research best practices. Additionally, they will be detail-oriented, self-motivated, and adaptable. #BI-Hybrid What You'll Do Collaborate with designers, developers, testing and deployment teams, and other analysts to implement new features into user-facing applications and chatbots Collect and analyze user conversation data to determine the best solution for an NLU language model (intents and entities) Apply machine learning or statistical modeling techniques to applications/data that use natural language processing (NLP); manipulate data with Python or other batch tools to prepare NLU models, i.e. tagging intents and entities, etc.Advise in the process of developing, deploying, and updating the NLP designs and applications Analyze user stories for NLU systems Evaluate NLU system performance and make recommendations for improvements, including modifications to the pipeline Research complex problems to find custom solutions for customer-specific needs  Maintain documentation for the consumption of business, developer, and tester audiences Developing and validating the performance of the overall design Supporting the developer of user acceptance testing by writing test plans with QA Identify edge cases Attend and present status updates at weekly team meetings on project deliverables to team members and upper management; attend project-related meetings and customer-facing meetings Research complex problems to find custom solutions for customer-specific needsAnalyze data to make improvements and updates to current scripts Qualifications - We encourage you to apply if you think your experience may be a match, even if you do not meet all of the qualifications. A Bachelor’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, Linguistics, or a related field 2+ years of experience with chatbots and AI/ML systems 1-2+ years of experience working with HumanFirst.AI, Dialogflow, Lex, Watson, Rasa, LUIS, Chatfuel, or similar open source or commercial conversational AI/ML platform Experience working with software engineers, developers, and/or UX designers in a highly technical environment Knowledge of data science and machine learning Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience working with large data sets, including using Python and other scripting tools to wrangle data Proficiency in analyzing and presenting observed insights and improvement plans Experience with voice and chat script development and design Proficiency with chatbot builders Proficiency with speech and language technologies, preferred. Knowledge of Git, preferred. Experience managing data science and/or machine learning projects, preferred. Strong research skills, preferred. Experience with end-to-end project development, preferred. Who We AreThe human voice is capable of conveying nuances and meaning that just can't be expressed through clicks and text messages. And for that reason, voice interactions have always had a special power to shape your perception and experiences. At Versay, we believe in the unique power of voice interactions to create more expressive, more intimate, and more efficient interpersonal interactions. Our experts work with Fortune 500 companies to help them serve their customers more efficiently and effectively through the use of various voice technologies. From basic network services to state-of-the-art IP telephony to cutting-edge real-time analytics, Versay technology makes millions of voice interactions better every day.We offer competitive compensation and affordable benefits with flexibility and choice to meet individual and family (including Domestic Partnerships) needs, including:· Multiple medical, dental, and vision plan options · Company-paid life insurance, short and long-term disability · 401(k) savings plan with company match (50% on first 6% of employee contribution) · 15 days total annual PTO. 1.25 days accrued per month. Accrual rates will increase with length of service.· Annual Bonus Program · Paid maternity and paternity leave · Relocation allowance · Employee referral bonus · Gym membership · Technical and Professional Development stipendWe are striving to implement and sustain an inclusive and equitable work environment for all employees by sourcing underrepresented groups and continually empowering those individuals within our organization to further enrich Versay's communication solutions. We recognize that equitable and unique individuals benefit our teams' problem-solving, innovation, and development efforts. Our offices are located in Deerfield and Chicago, IL. Interviews and onboarding are conducted in our offices when possible. We are observing a hybrid work arrangement based on business and team needs.
